Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Amulets (fish)
Description: Three amulets in the likeness of a fish, probably a Nile perch.  The fins and the details of the head are delicately depicted.  The light blue enamel is rather faded.  These objects, pierced near the head, were part of a necklace. They recall passages of the Book of the Dead and were possibly connected to the cults of Osiris and Isis.
